entries.title: Storm deaths ‘could have been prevented’, Indigenous leaders say
entries.description: The Rosebud Sioux Tribe in the US is seeking a presidential disaster declaration after six dead in winter snowstorms.

entries.title: Is debt cancellation the way forward for Sri Lanka?
entries.description: As 182 economists from around the world issued a call to cancel Sri Lanka's debt, not all experts agree.

entries.title: Ex-Republican candidate held for shootings at Democrats’ homes
entries.description: Solomon Pena allegedly plotted attacks against New Mexico officials after losing his own bid for office in November.

entries.title: Why is France being told to leave Burkina Faso?
entries.description: The former colonial power has been asked to withdraw its troops from the West African country.

entries.title: Poland increases pressure to send German-made tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: Poland says it is planning to send German-made battle tanks to Ukraine, but will first seek approval from Berlin.

entries.title: US Capitol riot: Four Oath Keepers guilty of seditious conspiracy
entries.description: Verdict marks major victory for US Justice Department in its push to prosecute those involved in January 6, 2021, riot.

entries.title: Man photographed with foot on Pelosi’s desk on Jan 6 found guilty
entries.description: An image of Richard Barnett reclining against the legislator's desk has become emblematic of the 2021 US Capitol attack.

entries.title: Burkina Faso confirms it has ended French military accord
entries.description: Burkina Faso gov't spokesman says the country wants to defend itself and France has one month to pull out troops.

entries.title: Erdogan warns Sweden on NATO bid after Quran burning protest
entries.description: Turkish president says Sweden should not expect Ankara's support in its bid to join the military alliance.

entries.title: ‘Terrorist’ designation for IRGC would harm EU security
entries.description: Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps is a leading counterterror force and essential to Europe's security interests.

entries.title: Musk on trial says he was sure he had Saudi backing to privatise
entries.description: Elon Musk is on trial for claims that he defrauded investors by tweeting he secured funds to privatise his firm Tesla.

entries.title: UK PM orders investigation into party chairman’s tax affairs
entries.description: Rishi Sunak says 'questions need answering' over fellow Conservative Party politician Nadhim Zahawi's dealings.

entries.title: US joins Europe with fresh sanctions over Iran protest crackdown
entries.description: US measures, taken in coordination with the EU and UK, target Iranian officials accused of suppressing demonstrations.

entries.title: Ex-FBI agent violated sanctions by aiding Russian oligarch: DOJ
entries.description: Former head of FBI counterintelligence division in New York allegedly worked for sanctioned oligarch Oleg Deripaska.

entries.title: Colombian activist killings hit record high in 2022: Ombudsman
entries.description: Human rights ombudsman says 215 activists and social leaders killed across Colombia last year, up from 145 in 2021.

entries.title: Spotify to lay off 6% of its employees
entries.description: The tech sector is facing a demand downturn after two years of pandemic-powered growth when it had hired aggressively.

entries.title: US man recounts seizing gun from shooter in Lunar New Year attack
entries.description: Police credit people who confronted California gunman who killed 10 with preventing more casualties.

entries.title: Lebanese judge probing 2020 Beirut port blast resumes inquiry
entries.description: The probe into the 2020 explosion had been derailed for months by legal challenges as well resistance from factions.

entries.title: Brazil-Argentina summit to focus on trade, economic integration
entries.description: Brazilian President Lula da Silva and Argentinian counterpart Fernandez are looking into a common currency.

entries.title: ChatGPT and the sweatshops powering the digital age
entries.description: The latest ChatGPT revelations are yet another reminder of the pervasive labour exploitation in digital innovation.

entries.title: Iraqi PM replaces Central Bank governor over currency drop
entries.description: Mohammed Shia al-Sudani's move comes after a fall in value of the Iraqi dinar against the US dollar.

entries.title: Pakistani court acquits police in Naqeebullah Mehsud murder case
entries.description: Family says it will appeal verdict in 2018 killing of aspiring model in Karachi that sparked protests.

entries.title: France remains ‘very sexist’: Watchdog sounds alarm
entries.description: Sexism is on the rise in France, with younger generations worst affected, the country's equality council said.

entries.title: Football can’t put an end to Algeria and Morocco’s bitter rivalry
entries.description: Morocco's withdrawal from Algeria-hosted African Nations Championship this month highlights dispute between neighbours.

entries.title: Norway arrests former Wagner fighter who escaped from Russia
entries.description: Andrey Medvedev, who is seeking asylum in the Nordic nation, could face deportation to Russia, rights group warns.

entries.title: The new year promises little change in Ruto’s Kenya
entries.description: The year 2023 will see the Kenyan state settle down to its customary role of parasite and protector of elite extraction.

entries.title: UN body condemns Quran burning in Sweden
entries.description: Alliance of Civilizations and several Muslim-majority countries denounce stunt by Danish far-right party leader.

entries.title: Nigerian flights disrupted as ground staff go on strike
entries.description: Flight disruptions are common in Nigeria due to logistics, labour union issues and fuel scarcity.

entries.title: Ex-Czech general leads presidential race over billionaire Babis
entries.description: Polls indicate former military official Petr Pavel will win out against scandal-hit former Prime Minister Andrej Babis.

entries.title: Why were Juventus docked points and what happens next?
entries.description: Italian football's foremost club has been plunged into chaos by a 15-point deduction over alleged financial wrongdoing.

entries.title: More sanctions as Iran and EU clash over IRGC ‘terror’ label
entries.description: EU foreign policy chief says that the bloc won't label the IRGC a 'terrorist' organisation, for now.

entries.title: Estonia, Latvia remove envoys to Russia in diplomatic downgrade
entries.description: Estonia, Latvia told their Russian envoys to leave after Moscow said it was downgrading diplomatic ties with Tallinn.

entries.title: Protests after Israeli threats to remove Palestinian village
entries.description: Khan al-Ahmar in the occupied West Bank lies in a corridor that Israel plans to use to link illegal Israeli settlements.

entries.title: Russia’s Lavrov defends naval drills with S Africa during visit
entries.description: South Africa has remained neutral on Russia's war in Ukraine but is a strategic military and trade partner for Moscow.

entries.title: Unknown gunmen kill popular Eswatini opposition politician
entries.description: Thulani Maseko was shot dead on Saturday night by unknown attackers.

entries.title: First female Palestinian pastor ordained in the Holy Land
entries.description: Sally Azar will head the English-speaking congregation at the Church of the Redeemer in Jerusalem.

entries.title: Monterey Park shooting: What, when and who?
entries.description: The suspect shot himself after killing 10 people at a dance club in the Los Angeles area.

entries.title: Pakistan hit by nationwide power outage after grid failure
entries.description: Minister says restoration work could take up to 12 hours, adding that a limited number of power grids are back on.

entries.title: ‘Now or never’: Kishida says Japan has to act on population drop
entries.description: Kishida says government will take steps to tackle the slowing birth rate, which fell to a record low in 2021.

entries.title: Ronaldo makes long-awaited Saudi Pro League debut for Al Nassr
entries.description: The 37-year-old Portuguese forward failed to score but his Riyadh-based club beat Ettifaq 1-0 to go top of the table.

entries.title: Prominent Cameroon journalist found dead after abduction
entries.description: The mutilated body of Martinez Zogo was found near the capital five days after he was taken by unknown assailants.

entries.title: Peru protests: Can the divide be bridged?
entries.description: Protesters urge president to step down while demanding root-and-branch change to address long-running inequality.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 334
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 334rd day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Spotify to announce layoffs as soon as this week: Bloomberg
entries.description: Swedish audio streaming giant reportedly planning job cuts after recent layoffs at Apple, Google, Microsoft and Amazon.

entries.title: Russian warship to join drills with China, South Africa navies
entries.description: Russian frigate armed with hypersonic missiles will participate in joint drills in South Africa in February, TASS says.

entries.title: Monterey Park gun attack shocks close-knit California community
entries.description: Residents thought their community was safe from the gun violence that continues to plague the US

entries.title: Video goes viral after Cambodia tries to silence popular rapper
entries.description: Censorship of a song on labour rights highlights the difficulty of raising awareness as government tightens its grip.
